hierarchy.file_name: Impact--Fix post-meeting recap generation in sales_followup_recommendations when meeting metadata is missing.docx

sections.text:
This change improves reliability of post‑meeting follow‑up recommendations by fixing recap generation when CRM meeting metadata is missing or incomplete. Today, some opportunities silently fail to show recaps and next‑step guidance if the meeting record is absent or fields like attendees, transcript/notes link, or outcome are empty, creating inconsistent user experience and lowering trust in the feature.

We will add defensive handling and sensible fallbacks so recap and next‑step templates can still render using best‑available data (e.g., opportunity context, prior activity, or partial meeting details). When inputs are partially available, the system should degrade gracefully rather than failing the entire recommendation set.

For cases where required inputs are truly unavailable, we will introduce structured error logging to capture the exact missing fields and the affected opportunity/meeting identifiers. This will improve observability, speed up support/debugging, and help us quantify how often data quality issues in the CRM impact output.

On the UI, we will replace silent omission with a clear “recap unavailable” state, so users understand why a recap isn’t shown and can take corrective action (e.g., update the meeting record or add notes). Overall impact: higher recommendation coverage, fewer confusing gaps, and clearer accountability between product behavior and underlying CRM data quality.
